intro: Racosperma insolitum, commonly known as the slender acacia, is a small shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Racosperma insolitum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils.
